resources.string: La Uascezze offers its customers a wide selection of typical products from the city of Bari in which they combine the best taste and genuineness. it is a MUST if you are in the city.
A place where you can taste good fish dishes, but certainly good food, spaghetti with seafood, grilled vegetables, mixed fried, and much more.
If the love for food brings you to bari and you want to taste a bit of this old town’s wonders, make sure you visit this place. It runs in a very old building, that kept it’s charm and architecture.

Authentic and historical tavern in the heart of Bari Vecchia, accessed by an arch, inside a narrow courtyard..table outdoors in good weather, friendly and simple service, excellent cuisine of Bari, Without great pretensions, you spend a nice evening without spending crazy figures.

A dish of both land and sea, the "tiella" barese inebriates the streets around the Basilica of San Nicola for over four centuries. every Bari family prepares it differently: who puts more potatoes, more rice, sometimes whole tomatoes, some add salsa and who, again, neither of the above and who, on the other hand, also add courgette.

Fave e cicoria (fava beans and chicory) is a popular dish in Puglia, the heel of Italy’s boot. It takes inspiration from Egyptian bean purées across the Mediterranean, and uses a few quality ingredients in similar ways. Bitter greens balance the warm, hearty ﬂavor of the bean puree perfectly in this simple 4-ingredient dish.

Puglia’s sun-soaked landscape in southern Italy is celebrated for its signature dish, orecchiette with broccoli rabe. The pasta’s “little ears,” as “orecchiette” translates, are a homemade pasta made exclusively in southern italy.
Focaccia Barese is a street food with very light dough, different than pizza. It’s topped with Olio Terra di Bari, oven baked black olives and tomatoes. A speciality you must try without .

Strictly fried and strictly accompanied by a cold beer: praise to the panzerotto. A must, a symbol, a tradition. Bari without him would not be the same and the people without the long-awaited "panzerottata" would have one less reason to look forward to Christmas Eve.
